segment.source: Using UE-V 2.x with Application Virtualization Applications
segment.target: Using UE-V 2.x with Application Virtualization Applications

segment.source: Using UE-V 2.x with Application Virtualization Applications
segment.target: Using UE-V 2.x with Application Virtualization Applications

segment.source: Using UE-V 2.x with Application Virtualization Applications
segment.target: Using UE-V 2.x with Application Virtualization Applications

segment.source: Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) 2.0, 2.1, and 2.1 SP1 support Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) applications without any required modifications to either the App-V package or the UE-V template.
segment.target: Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) 2.0, 2.1, and 2.1 SP1 support Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) applications without any required modifications to either the App-V package or the UE-V template.

segment.source: However, an additional step is required because you cannot run the UE-V Generator directly on a virtualized App-V application.
segment.target: However, an additional step is required because you cannot run the UE-V Generator directly on a virtualized App-V application.

segment.source: Instead, you must install the application locally, generate the template, and then apply the template to the virtualized application.
segment.target: Instead, you must install the application locally, generate the template, and then apply the template to the virtualized application.

segment.source: UE-V supports App-V 4.5, App-V 4.6, and App-V 5.0 packages.
segment.target: UE-V supports App-V 4.5, App-V 4.6, and App-V 5.0 packages.

segment.source: UE-V settings synchronization for App-V applications
segment.target: UE-V settings synchronization for App-V applications

segment.source: UE-V monitors when an application opens by the program name and, optionally, by file version numbers and product version numbers, whether the application is installed locally or virtually by using App-V.
segment.target: UE-V monitors when an application opens by the program name and, optionally, by file version numbers and product version numbers, whether the application is installed locally or virtually by using App-V.

segment.source: When the application starts, UE-V monitors the App-V process, applies any settings that are stored in the user's settings storage path, and then enables the application to start normally.
segment.target: When the application starts, UE-V monitors the App-V process, applies any settings that are stored in the user's settings storage path, and then enables the application to start normally.

segment.source: UE-V monitors App-V applications and automatically translates the relevant file and registry paths to the virtualized location as opposed to the physical location outside the App-V computing environment.
segment.target: UE-V monitors App-V applications and automatically translates the relevant file and registry paths to the virtualized location as opposed to the physical location outside the App-V computing environment.

segment.source: To implement settings synchronization for a virtualized application
segment.target: To implement settings synchronization for a virtualized application

segment.source: Run the UE-V Generator to collect the settings of the locally installed application whose settings you want to synchronize between computers.
segment.target: Run the UE-V Generator to collect the settings of the locally installed application whose settings you want to synchronize between computers.

segment.source: This process creates a settings location template.
segment.target: This process creates a settings location template.

segment.source: If you use a built-in template such as the Microsoft Office 2010 template, skip this step.
segment.target: If you use a built-in template such as the Microsoft Office 2010 template, skip this step.

segment.source: For more information about running the UE-V Generator, see Deploy UE-V 2.x for Custom Applications.
segment.target: For more information about running the UE-V Generator, see Deploy UE-V 2.x for Custom Applications.

segment.source: Install the App-V application package if you have not already done so.
segment.target: Install the App-V application package if you have not already done so.

segment.source: Publish the template to the location of your settings template catalog or manually install the template by using the Windows PowerShell cmdlet.
segment.target: Publish the template to the location of your settings template catalog or manually install the template by using the Windows PowerShell cmdlet.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you publish the newly created template to the settings template catalog, the client does not receive the template until the sync provider updates the settings.
segment.target: If you publish the newly created template to the settings template catalog, the client does not receive the template until the sync provider updates the settings.

segment.source: To manually start this process, open Task Scheduler, expand Task Scheduler Library, expand Microsoft, and expand UE-V.
segment.target: To manually start this process, open Task Scheduler, expand Task Scheduler Library, expand Microsoft, and expand UE-V.

segment.source: In the results pane, right-click Template Auto Update, and then click Run.
segment.target: In the results pane, right-click Template Auto Update, and then click Run.

segment.source: Start the App-V package.
segment.target: Start the App-V package.

segment.source: Got a suggestion for UE-V?
segment.target: Got a suggestion for UE-V?

segment.source: Add or vote on suggestions here.
segment.target: Add or vote on suggestions here.

segment.source: For UE-V issues, use the UE-V TechNet Forum.
segment.target: For UE-V issues, use the UE-V TechNet Forum.

segment.target: Related topics
